text: “A group of people who “earn less money than most people.”
“A group of people who do not have the privilege of living in healthy conditions or getting an education or having a reasonable standard of living.“
“A group of people “who don't have enough to meet their basic needs.”
“A group of people who are “the richest, most powerful, best-educated, or best-trained in a society.”
“Positive steps taken to increase the representation of women and minorities in areas of employment, education, and culture.”
“A measure of an individual’s position in a society based on their social class and financial level when relating to how they differ from other groups of people.”
“Relating to the ability to think and understand ideas at a high level, or involving ideas.”
“The ability to forget about aspects of who you are because they represent the majority demographics of your country or organization.”
“A set idea that people have about what someone or something is like, especially an idea that is wrong.”
“An unfair and unreasonable opinion or feeling, especially when formed without enough thought or knowledge.”
An “enduring pattern of an individual’s emotional, romantic or physical attraction to other people.”
“A bias or prejudice that is present but not consciously held or recognized.”
“The act of reserving a proportional part or share for disadvantaged communities as part of affirmative action in a society.”
